aboutMe: I'm Genos, a frontend engineer who loves weight training.
aboutMe-F2E: I mainly write Vue3, Nuxt3, and a little bit of Next.js. I'm not as familiar with Vue as I am with React, but I've written various front-stage and back-stage projects, from scratch, maintenance, to refactoring.
aboutMe-Workout: In the past few years, I mainly focused on four exercises (squat, bench press, deadlift, and military press). Starting from 2024, I began to learn weight-lifting.
aboutMe-summarize: There are too many things to learn in frontend and weight training. Every little breakthrough is a moment worth commemorating.

cal.remind: General testing equipment (such as Inbody) has an error range. Only by going to a medical center for long-term monitoring can you get more accurate data. Don't get lost in the numbers and listen to the changes in your body.

ffmi.description: FFMI is a measure of muscle mass. It is calculated by obtaining fat-free mass and adjusting it based on height. It provides more valuable insights than BMI but requires a device to measure body fat.
ffmi.level5: Scores considered suspicious but still attainable naturally 26~27
ffmi.level6: Highly unlikely scores to be obtained naturally without steroid usage 28~30

bmi.description: BMI is used to assess whether a person is overweight or underweight. The formula considers only height and weight, without accounting for body composition, making it unsuitable for athletes with high muscle mass.

bmr.description: BMR is the minimum number of calories required to sustain essential body functions (breathing, metabolism) for a day, excluding any additional physical activity.

tdee.description: TDEE is BMR plus the calories burned from daily activities and food intake.
tdee.activityLevelDescription: Since each person perceives intensity and frequency differently, the activity levels are difficult to quantify precisely and should be used as a simple reference.
tdee.level0: Sedentary lifestyle (little to no exercise) TDEE = BMR x 1.2
tdee.level1: Light activity (light exercise 1-3 days per week) TDEE = BMR x 1.375
tdee.level2: Moderate activity (moderate exercise 3-5 days per week) TDEE = BMR x 1.55
tdee.level3: High activity (intense exercise 6-7 days per week) TDEE = BMR x 1.725
tdee.level4: Very high activity (high-intensity exercise or physical labor throughout the day) TDEE = BMR x 1.9

googleSheetI18n: Use GoogleSheet to manage i18n dictionary files
nuxtFetch: Understanding Data Fetching (API Connection) in Nuxt
nuxtEnv: How to use .env variables in Nuxt
vueStorybook: Vue3 + Vite + Storybook + TailwindCSS + I18n settings
